{{cpp/title|money_get}}
{{cpp/locale/money_get/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=locale|1=
template&lt; 
    class CharT,
    class InputIt = std::istreambuf_iterator&lt;CharT&gt;
&gt; class money_get;
}}

Class template {{tt|std::money_get}} encapsulates the rules for parsing monetary values from character streams. The standard I/O manipulator {{lc|std::get_money}} uses the {{tt|std::money_get}} facet of the I/O stream's locale.

{{inheritance diagram/std-money_get}}

If a {{tt|std::money_get}} specialization is not guaranteed to be provided by the standard library (see below), the behaviors of its {{lc|get()}} and {{lc|do_get()}} are not guaranteed as specified.

===Specializations===
The standard library is guaranteed to provide the following specializations (they are {{rlp|locale|required to be implemented by any locale object}}):
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc header|locale}}
{{dsc|{{c/core|std::money_get&lt;char&gt;}}|parses narrow string representations of monetary values}}
{{dsc|{{c/core|std::money_get&lt;wchar_t&gt;}}|parses wide string representations of monetary values}}
{{dsc end}}

In addition, the standard library is also guaranteed to provide every specialization that satisfies the following type requirements:
* {{tt|CharT}} is one of
** {{c/core|char}},
** {{c/core|wchar_t}}, and
** any other implementation-defined [[cpp/string|character container type]] that meets the requirements for a character on which any of the [[cpp/io|iostream components]] can be instantiated; and
* {{tt|InputIt}} must meet the requirements of {{named req|InputIterator}}.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;iterator&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::string str = "$1.11 $2.22 $3.33";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::fixed &lt;&lt; std::setprecision(2);
    
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\"' &lt;&lt; str &lt;&lt; "\" parsed with the I/O manipulator: ";
    std::istringstream s1(str);
    s1.imbue(std::locale("en_US.UTF-8"));
    
    long double val;
    while (s1 &gt;&gt; std::get_money(val))
        std::cout &lt;&lt; val / 100 &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
    
    str = "USD  1,234.56";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\"' &lt;&lt; str &lt;&lt; "\" parsed with the facet directly: ";
    std::istringstream s2(str);
    s2.imbue(std::locale("en_US.UTF-8"));
    
    auto&amp; f = std::use_facet&lt;std::money_get&lt;char&gt;&gt;(s2.getloc());
    std::ios_base::iostate err;
    std::istreambuf_iterator&lt;char&gt; beg(s2), end;
    f.get(beg, end, true, s2, err, val);
    
    std::cout &lt;&lt; val / 100 &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
"$1.11 $2.22 $3.33" parsed with the I/O manipulator: 1.11 2.22 3.33
"USD  1,234.56" parsed with the facet directly: 1234.56
}}
